title: Topic 001 Question 108
body: A team of data scientists infrequently needs to use a Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) cluster that you manage. They require GPUs for some long-running, non- restartable jobs. You want to minimize cost. What should you do?
options: Enable node auto-provisioning on the GKE cluster.
Create a VerticalPodAutscaler for those workloads.
Create a node pool with preemptible VMs and GPUs attached to those VMs.
Create a node pool of instances with GPUs, and enable autoscaling on this node pool with a minimum size of 1.
